snippet: Deputy Chief John Sprague, a 25-year veteran, was placed on modified duty after he indicated he would decline to answer questions before a federal grand jury.
abstract: Deputy Chief John Sprague of New York Police Dept is placed on modified duty after indicating he will refuse to appear before federal grand jury in connection with broad federal investigation into corruption in New York City; inquiry is focusing on two businessmen tied to Mayor Bill de Blasio who may have attempted to cultivate contacts with police officials.
lead_paragraph: Deputy Chief John Sprague, a 25-year veteran, was placed on modified duty after he indicated he would decline to answer questions before a federal grand jury.

headline.main: New York Police Official Stripped of Badge Amid Corruption Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Police Official Stripped of Badge Amid Broad Corruption Inquiry
